jade.util
Class Tools

java.lang.Object
  jade.util.Tools

public final class Tools
extends java.lang.Object

Tools contains lots of methods that are generally useful, but do not fit in any one jade class.

Method Detail

keyToDir

public static Coord keyToDir(char key,
                             boolean vi,
                             boolean numeric)
This method takes a keypress and turns it into a direction. The x and y coordinates of the returned direction will be between -1 and 1. This coord can then be used to translate other coord in the direction of the keypress.

Parameters:
key - the character of the keypress
vi - if true, then keyboard controls for moving the cursor in vim will be allowed.
numeric - if true, then keyboard controls for moving the cursor on a numpad will be allowed
Returns:
the direction of the key press, or null if the key was non-direction based on the choosen keyset(s)

strHasSuffix

public static boolean strHasSuffix(java.lang.String str,
                                   java.lang.String suffix)
Returns true if the string has the specified suffix. The check is case sensitive.

Parameters:
str - the string to be tested
suffix - the suffix to be tested
Returns:
true if the string has the specified suffix

strEnsureSuffix

public static java.lang.String strEnsureSuffix(java.lang.String str,
                                               java.lang.String suffix)
Returns a string that has the specified suffix. If the input string already has the suffix, then it will be returned unchanged, otherwise, return value will be the string concatonated with the suffix.

Parameters:
str - the string in question
suffix - the suffix to tested
Returns:
a string that has the specified suffix

strEnsureLength

public static java.lang.String strEnsureLength(java.lang.String str,
                                               int length)
Returns a string that has at least the specified length. If the input string has a length greater or equal to the given length, then it will be returned unchanged. Otherwise, the string will be returned after concationation with enough spaces to meet the length requirement.

Parameters:
str - the string in question
length - the minimum length of the return value
Returns:
a string that is at least the specified length

intToAlpha

public static char intToAlpha(int i)
Translates an integer to a character where 0 maps to 'a', 1 to 'b', 2 to 'c' and so on.

Parameters:
i - the integer to be converted
Returns:
the character value of i

alphaToInt

public static int alphaToInt(char ch)
Translates a character to an integer where 'a' maps to 0, 'b' to 1, 'c' to 2 and so on.

Parameters:
ch - the character to be converted
Returns:
the integer value of ch
